robot_capabilities.differential_drive_robot_1: Moves on flat indoor office surfaces. Robopt has a speaker. Equipped with lidar, camera, and GPS for indoor navigation. Can carry files, folders, or envelopes. Avoids obstacles and stops at doors. Can visit specific departments or desks.
robot_capabilities.differential_drive_robot_2: Identical to robot_1.Robot has a Speaker. Capable of document pickup and delivery tasks across office zones. Can respond to delivery requests and report task status.
robot_capabilities.differential_drive_robot_3: Same capability as robot_1 and robot_2.Robot has a Speaker. Optimized for routing efficiency and load balancing when multiple delivery tasks are active.

task_specific_rules: Each robot can carry files between rooms, departments, and desks.
If multiple delivery requests exist, tasks should be distributed among available robots.
Robots must avoid entering restricted areas and should wait outside closed doors.
If a robot is already carrying files, assign new pickup to an idle robot.
One robot can take multiple files to the same destination if space allows.
One robot can deliver multiple file from one person to multiple people if space allows.
If two robots reach the same delivery zone, stagger their wait times to avoid congestion.
Each robot should acknowledge delivery completion and return to standby or accept next task.
task_replanning_rules: If a robot cannot access a room, reroute or delegate to another robot.
If a robot's battery is low, pause delivery and send another robot to resume the task.
Tasks should not be duplicated across robots unless explicitly allowed for redundancy.
